intro: Euploca pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's euploca, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white flowers bloom in late spring. Euploca pringlei is of conservation interest due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in its native habitat.
